author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Sept. 19
text:
Number of the day
$3.3 billion
That’s how much Coca-Cola has been told that it owes the IRS in taxes and interest for 2007 to 2009, the company said Friday. The disagreement is over how much Coke should report as taxable income in the U.S., in relation with licensing that allows affiliates to sell products overseas. The company said in a regulatory filing that it believes the assessments are without merit and plans to pursue “all administrative and judicial remedies necessary to resolve the matter.”
Huh?
Peace , the $2.99 ad blocker that was a top seller in the App Store after Apple released iOS 9, has been discontinued by creator Marco Arment . He said that although he believes that many sites have excessive ads that deserve to be blocked, other sites that don’t deserve it are also being hurt. “Even though I’m ‘winning,’ I’ve enjoyed none of it,” Arment wrote in a blog post . “That’s why I’m withdrawing from the market.”
Rumor has it
Petco Holdings is looking at being acquired by PetSmart , Reuters reported Friday , citing anonymous sources. Reuters said that the talks come after PetSmart ruled out a deal with Petco last year, partly because of potential antitrust obstacles.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
